title: Logo & Business Card for Web Design Company
content:
Hi,

I designed a logo and a business card for my new [web design business](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725154440/http:/www.designbits.de/) and I need some feedback regarding composition, choice of colour, kerning etc. In fact, this is the first time that I'm designing a business card...

Thanks for any input in this matter.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725154440im_/http:/typophile.com/files/vcard_6537.jpg)
author: Tintin81

comments.content:
Nice indeed, I like the T. Have you printed it out  
to see how the light blue might reacted with the  
dark background?

Guerrizmo+Design  
No man is an island unto himself\_John Donne

Hi Typedog,

No, I haven't printed it out because my printer may well run out of ink half the way through ;-)

Do you think it's necessary to do that? I'm entirely new to print design, have mostly done web design before. I designed the vcard in CMYK mode in Photoshop so I reckon it should come out ok on paper?

[Webdesign Hamburg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725154440/http:/www.designbits.de/)

Greetings Tintin81!

Yes indeed it is, you do not want to have a suprise when it  
is time to print. I was taught to do it in black and white first  
and then move onto color. Print can be a hassle sometimes because  
what you see on the screen is not what you will get on paper.  
Good look!

Guerrizmo+Design  
No man is an island unto himself\_John Donne
